<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_207260_technic_0_useful_scripts"><x_207260_technic_0_useful_scripts action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><name>Undocumented: GlideTableParentChange</name><number>SCRIPT0001050</number><script><![CDATA[/*There are many undocumented ServiceNow APIs that have existed since the beginning. 
These are a couple that you may come across needing either as a system administrator 
or developer. */

 

//The first is the GlideTableParentChange if you need to move a table to be extended 
//from another table. An example use case is that you may have accidently created it 
//under the wrong table, like the wrong CI or task table.

 

var table = ''; //table you want to extend var old_parent = '';
var new_parent = ''; //the table you want to extend to, like cmdb_ci or task
var changer = new GlideTableParentChange(table);
changer.change(old_parent, new_parent);
 
/*
The second is GlideDBUtil.promoteColumn which is a 
single one line script that lets you move a column up to
 the parent level table. This also might be useful in 
 CMDB management, where you may have created a column
under a table, but it really need to be moved to the 
  parent so more CIs can use the field. 
  */

 

GlideDBUtil.promoteColumn('table_to_move_from', 'table_to_move_to', 'field_to_move', true);]]></script><sys_class_name>x_207260_technic_0_useful_scripts</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2024-01-11 07:47:37</sys_created_on><sys_id>d88764e3072739105295f19d7c1ed0eb</sys_id><sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Undocumented: GlideTableParentChange</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Technical Repo" source="x_207260_technic_0">6362d051072ff5d05295f19d7c1ed08f</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Technical Repo">6362d051072ff5d05295f19d7c1ed08f</sys_scope><sys_update_name>x_207260_technic_0_useful_scripts_d88764e3072739105295f19d7c1ed0eb</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2024-01-11 07:47:37</sys_updated_on></x_207260_technic_0_useful_scripts></record_update>
